subject: Internal Audit, Monitoring,
body:
Internal Audit, Monitoring, Consulting and Investigations Division
From Mrs.Inga-Britt Ahlenius.
UNITED NATIONS SCAM VICTIMS COMPENSATIONS PAYMENTS.
From Mrs.Inga-Britt Ahlenius.
Attn: Scam Victim.
This is to bring to your notice that after I retired from this office I was appointed again and I was delegated from the United Nations To Central Bank to pay 150 scam victims $5,000,000.00 (FIVE MILLION UNITED STATE DOLLAR) each. You are listed and approved for this payment as one of the scammed victims to be paid this amount, get back to me as soon as possible for the immediate payments of your $5,000,000.00 compensation funds.
On this faithful recommendation, we want you to know that during the last U.N. meetings held at Abuja, Nigeria, it was alarmed so much by the world in the meetings on the loss of funds by various individuals to the scams artists operating in syndicates all over the world today.In order to compensate victims, the U.N Body in conjunction with the Nigerian Government is now paying 150 victims of these operators $5,000,000.00 each in accordance with the U.N. recommendations.
Due to the corrupt and inefficient Banking Systems in Nigeria, the payments are to be supervised by the United Nations' Officials and the Central Bank of Nigeria as the corresponding paying treasury department United Bank of Africa According to the number of applicants at hand, 114 Beneficiaries have been paid, half of the victims are from the United States, we still have 36 left to be paid the compensations of $5,000,000.00 each.
Your particulars were mentioned by one of the Syndicates who was arrested as one of their victims of the operations, you are hereby warned not to communicate or duplicate this message to him for any reason whatsoever as the U.S. secret service is already on the trail of the other criminals. Other victims who have not been contacted can submit their application as well for scrutiny and possible
consideration.
You are thereby advised to contact the private officer of the treasury department United Bank of Africa through the following information.
Name: Mark Akinshola
Email: 
markakinshola4@gmail.com
You will receive your compensation payments through which the options You will be detailed with the modalities as you contact the private officer of the treasury department United Bank of Africa.
Sincerely yours,
Mrs.Inga-Britt Ahlenius.

subject: Re:   Internal Audit, Monitoring,
body:
Hello Ahlenius,

Thank you for reaching out and sharing this information. It's quite surprising to hear about the situation. I'm curious, how did my name come up in this list of victims? Also, could you please provide more details about these meetings held at Abuja, Nigeria? 

I'm also interested in understanding how the payment process works. You mentioned that there are different options for receiving payments. Could you elaborate on what these options are?

Looking forward to your response.

Best regards.

Best wishes,
Nadine

subject: Re: Internal Audit, Monitoring,
body:
Dear  Beneficiary

I am in receipt of your email and to let you know that your UN approved
scam victim compensation payment US$5M has been approved for payment.

In view of the above, you are advised to fill the form attached on this
email or provide me the below information for onward issuance of all the
legal backup documents that will make you eligible to stand for this claim.


Full Name:
Occupation:
Full Address:
City:
Zip Code:
Whatsapp Phone Number:
Scan Copy of your Valid ID card:


Furthermore, Choose any of our payment options that is most suitable for
you to receive your UN approved scam victim compensation payment valued to
the tune of US$5M only.

ATM CARD:
ONLINE BANKING :
WIRE TRANSFER (KTT)


Waiting for the above information or the filled form for onward issuance of
the legal backup documents that will make you eligible to stand for this
claim and immediate release of your approved UN scam victim compensation
payment through your preferred choice of payment as indicated above or in
the form, call me on the telephone below after returning the filled form by
email attachment or providing the above information by email for more
clarifications.

Mark Akinshola
PRIVATE OFFICIAL OF THE TREASURY DEPARTMENT
UNITED BANK OF AFRICA.

subject: Re: Internal Audit, Monitoring,
body:
Hello Mark Akinshola,

Thank you for your email. It's quite exciting to hear about this UN approved payment! I'm not entirely sure how I became eligible for such a claim, but it certainly sounds interesting.

Could you please provide more details about this process? How does the wire transfer KTT work? And what kind of legal backup documents are required for me to stand for this claim?

I look forward to hearing from you soon.

Best regards.

Best wishes,
Nadine

body:

Thank you for your prompt response and the detailed information. I appreciate your assistance in this matter. 

I understand that you need some details from me to proceed with the Key Tested wire transfer KTT. However, could you please clarify what specific information you require? I want to make sure I provide the correct details.

Also, could you explain a bit more about these legal backup documents? What exactly do they entail and how do they help in making me eligible for this claim?

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best regards.

Best wishes,
Nadine

subject: Re: Internal Audit, Monitoring,
body:
Dear  Beneficiary

Prior to your question a KTT transfer utilizes a secure communication
system that verifies the identity of both the sender and recipient before
funds are released. This makes KTT an ideal option for high-value
transactions where security is paramount.

Coming to the second question, as one of the UN scam victim compensation
payments, the UN will issue a payment approval on your behalf that will
make you eligible to stand for this claim.

Coming to your third question, what legal backup documents means, for your
information the approving ministries will issue a legal backup document on
your behalf that will make you eligible to stand for this claim and prove
that this payment is legitimate.

Having been clarified on this matter you are advised to fill the form
attached on this email or provide me the below information alongside with
your full banking information where you want your scam victim compensation
payment to be transferred.



Full Name:
Occupation:
Full Address:
City:
Zip Code:
Whatsapp Phone Number:
Scan Copy of your Valid ID card:

Waiting for the above information or the filled form and your full banking
information for onward issuance of the legal backup documents that will
make you eligible to stand for this claim and immediate release of your
approved UN scam victim compensation payment through  Key Tested
Telegraphic wire transfer (KTT).

Mark Akinshola
PRIVATE OFFICIAL OF THE TREASURY DEPARTMENT
UNITED BANK OF AFRICA.
WHATSAPP PHONE NUMBER: +234-7035922199

subject: Re: Internal Audit, Monitoring,
body:
Hello Mark Akinshola,

Thank you for your detailed response. It's quite interesting to learn about the KTT transfer system and how it ensures security for both parties involved. I appreciate the explanation.

Regarding the UN scam victim payments, could you please elaborate more on how the UN issues payment approval? What is the process like?

Also, I'm curious about these legal backup documents issued by approving ministries. Could you provide more information on what these documents contain and their importance in this claim process?

I'm eager to understand more before proceeding with providing my banking details. Your patience and assistance are much appreciated.

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best wishes,
Nadine

subject: Re: Internal Audit, Monitoring,
body:
Hello Mark Akinshola,

Thank you for your email. It's great to hear that the bank is ready to process my payment. I'm a bit confused about some of the details though, could you please clarify?

You mentioned needing an IBAN number from my bank. Could you explain what this is and why it's necessary? Also, you asked for 'the below too' but I'm not sure what information you're referring to.

I'm also curious about the legal backup documents that will make me eligible for this claim. Could you provide more information on these documents and how they work?

Lastly, I noticed that you've provided a telephone number for further communication. While I appreciate this, I prefer to keep our conversation here in email for now if that's okay with you.

Looking forward to your response.

Best wishes,
Nadine
